abstracts.cdata!:
The Irrigation Rehabilitation Emergency
            Project for Armenia had an overall satisfactory outcome,
            with the performances of both the Bank and the borrower
            being deemed satisfactory, while the risk to the development
            outcome was felt to be low or negligible. The project
            development objective indicators as well as the intermediate
            outcome indicators were achieved completely, and in some
            cases, had even exceeded the target. Significant lessons
            learned during the course of implementing the project are:
            1) projects that are simple in design and singularly focused
            perform well and have a high likelihood of achieving their
            objectives; 2) addressing priority needs of local
            populations is critical for the successful implementation of
            rural development projects; 3) irrigation projects can
            provide an important safety net for rural populations,
            especially during times of economic downturn; 4) projects
            prepared rapidly must have in-built flexibility to respond
            to emerging needs and situations; and 5) establishing and
            strengthening Water User Associations (WUAs) is a long-term undertaking.
